title: Extinction Rebellion protester dragged from Tube train by commuters then repeatedly kicked while on ground
text:
Footage has emerged of an Extinction Rebellion protester being dragged from the roof of a Tube train and attacked by angry commuters.

Video posted on social media showed several activists climbing on to a train at Canning Town station in east London during rush hour on Thursday morning.

Commuters can be heard swearing and shouting at them as they hold a sign reading: “Business as usual = death.”

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Several people throw objects at the climate change protesters.

In another clip posted on Twitter, one of the activists can be seen being pulled from the train by his foot. He ends up on the platform, surrounded by a crowd who appear to punch and kick him.

A member of Transport for London (TfL) staff appears to stop people from attacking the male activist further by intervening and holding them back.

British Transport Police said there had been four arrests so far at Stratford and Canning Town on the Jubilee Line.

“Specialist Protest Removal Teams remain at Shadwell station, and are working to resume services as soon as possible,” it said in a statement.

“We continue to urge protesters to not target the London Underground network. This is dangerous, not only for protesters but for commuters.

“We have increased our patrols on the London Underground and at other rail hubs throughout London.”

A poll on the Extinction Rebellion Telegram chat showed 86 per cent of members were against action targeting the London Underground.

Just 4 per cent approved of the action, while 7 per cent approved if they could be sure trains would not get blocked underground.
